channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: ‘Compute Equals Revenues’: Nvidia Needs Jensen Huang’s New Catchphrase to Be True
item.description: Here's everything you need to know from Nvidia's latest earnings call.

item.title: 3 must-see horror movies on HBO Max if you want a serious midweek scare
item.description: Cozy up and turn down the lights with these scary movies that are perfect for a midweek watch.

item.title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff: This isn’t our first SaaSpocalypse
item.description: Salesforce reported a solid year-end earnings and then pulled out all the stops to ward off more talk of the death of its business to AI.

item.title: Valve Has Been ‘Letting Children and Adults Alike Illegally Gamble,’ New York A.G. Alleges
item.description: The explosive suit involves loot boxes and their supposed psychological effects.

item.title: Anthropic drops its signature safety promise and rewrites AI guardrails
item.description: Anthropic has rewritten its flagship safety policy, dropping its once-defining 'no release until safe' pledge in favor of a more flexible, transparency-based framework.

item.title: ‘Scorsese’s movie scared the hell out of me’: Amy Adams previews Apple TV’s Cape Fear remake — but the original movies aren’t streaming anywhere
item.description: Apple TV is set to reimagine Martin Scorsese’s 90s thriller Cape Fear into a new 10-part series, but I can’t stream the original movie anywhere.

item.title: The rumored touchscreen MacBook Pro could get the iPhone’s Dynamic Island, but still lack one key feature
item.description: A new report says the touchscreen MacBook Pro will have a Dynamic Island, but there’s no mention of Face ID.

item.title: The biggest barrier to accessibility is not usability
item.description: People avoid products that signal limitation, but they shouldn’t. Accessibility is often treated as a technical problem. Does it meet standards? Is it ergonomic? Is it safe? Those questions matter, but they are incomplete. Many products fail not because they don’t function, but because they make the user feel singled out.

item.title: There's a sneaky way to watch Survivor 50 for free
item.description: We uncovered a sneaky way to watch Survivor 50 for FREE – from anywhere in the world, without coughing up for a Premium streaming subscription or cable. Here's the trick...
